body_html:
@zou3519  In the original code, I just used pytorch calls actually.
I used torchvision.transforms.ToTensor and torch.utils.data.DataLoader to load data in parent process and subprocess separately. But it hung. Then I read the source code, reduced the codes that didn't matter. Finally I got that it's the np.transpose ( in torchvision.transforms.ToTensor) and torch.stack (in torch.utils.data.DataLoader) that caused deadlock.
body_text:
@zou3519  In the original code, I just used pytorch calls actually.
I used torchvision.transforms.ToTensor and torch.utils.data.DataLoader to load data in parent process and subprocess separately. But it hung. Then I read the source code, reduced the codes that didn't matter. Finally I got that it's the np.transpose ( in torchvision.transforms.ToTensor) and torch.stack (in torch.utils.data.DataLoader) that caused deadlock.
body:
@zou3519  In the original code, I just used pytorch calls actually.
I used `torchvision.transforms.ToTensor` and `torch.utils.data.DataLoader` to load data in parent process and subprocess separately. But it hung. Then I read the source code, reduced the codes that didn't matter. Finally I got that it's the `np.transpose` ( in `torchvision.transforms.ToTensor`) and `torch.stack` (in `torch.utils.data.DataLoader`) that caused deadlock.
